title: Charlotte Pudding's Third Eye Identity Theory
theoryText: When Episode 571 first aired, fans noticed a three-eyed girl sitting near Big Mom and theorized this was Charlotte Pudding, who would later become important to the story. Many fans speculated about the significance of her third eye and her relationship to Big Mom. The theory was that she was one of Big Mom's daughters and that her third eye would be a major plot point.
author: One Piece Fandom (Various fans)
spoilerWarning: This theory was confirmed in the Whole Cake Island arc. The third eye's significance and Pudding's role in Sanji's arranged marriage became major plot points.

title: Luffy Will Destroy Fish-Man Island Theory
theoryText: After Luffy declared Fish-Man Island as his territory in Episode 571, fans connected this to Madam Shyarly's prophecy that Luffy would destroy Fish-Man Island. The theory suggests that Luffy's challenge to Big Mom and claim over the island will eventually lead to its destruction, possibly through a battle with Big Mom or as part of destroying the Red Line to create the All Blue.
author: One Piece Fandom
spoilerWarning: This theory involves future arcs and the possible destruction of Fish-Man Island.

title: Big Mom's Sweet Obsession Origin Theory
theoryText: After seeing Big Mom's irrational obsession with sweets over valuable treasure in Episode 571, fans theorized that there must be a traumatic or significant backstory explaining why she values candy so highly. Many speculated it was connected to her childhood or a past trauma involving food scarcity.
author: One Piece Community
spoilerWarning: This theory was confirmed in Big Mom's backstory during the Whole Cake Island arc, revealing her tragic childhood.

title: Pekoms as First Mink Foreshadowing Theory
theoryText: When Pekoms debuted in Episode 571 as a lion-man, fans theorized he might be from a specific race of animal-people. This was before the Mink Tribe was properly introduced. The theory suggested there would be an entire civilization of such beings, which was confirmed with Zou arc.
author: One Piece Theorists
spoilerWarning: This theory was confirmed with the introduction of Zou and the Mink Tribe.

title: Road Poneglyph and Big Mom Connection Theory
theoryText: After learning Big Mom claimed Fish-Man Island after Whitebeard's death in Episode 571, fans theorized that Big Mom was searching for the Road Poneglyph that was once on Fish-Man Island. The theory suggested this was her real motivation for claiming the territory, with the candy tribute being secondary.
author: One Piece Lore Community
spoilerWarning: This theory involves Road Poneglyphs and Big Mom's true motivations revealed in Whole Cake Island arc.
